context: will this work with a 32 bit os?
response: Mine is used on two multiboot laptops.  It 'just works' on WinXPpro64, WinVista64, several Linux distros Mint9(32&64), Mint12, Mint13, Fedora15, Sabayon, and all without loading any special drivers.  The package comes with windows drivers for optical output, but never installed or attempted optical connection.  It probably works ok on any reasonably recent OS.

context: Is it all strictly PvP or is there some PvE as well?
response: Alot of PVE mainly but it does support a decent amount of pvp so far.

context: Will this work with Windows 8.1 64 bit?
response: I don't know for sure - I was using windows 7., 64 bit and it seemed to work ok.  There were some bugs and hang ups but it eventually worked ok

context: What happens if i leave the dualshock 4 on the charging station while it is plugged it even when the battery of the dualshock 4 is fully charged
response: You get sent back to 1988.

context: How does it compare to the Logitech G600? I own a G600 and my fat thumb has a hard time finding the 12 side buttons. I end up only using 3 or 4
response: I never used a G600 but just by looking at comparison pictures of the two I would imagine it would be a lot easier to use the M95. I'm gradually increasing the number of buttons I am using with my thumb, so far I'm up to 5 okay with no real issues ergonomic wise.

context: Can you fit the charger in the case as well ?
response: No you can not.

context: How does the base recharge the batteries? Does it plug in? Or does it have to have batteries in it?
response: That's the thing, no more batteries!

context: will this work on a lg smart tv? thanks
response: yes, it comes with various connections. Best with an xbox 1.

context: how does this work i got this in mail and disc wont read i think its too small
response: Try this link: http://www.microsoft.com/hardware/en-us/d/xbox-360-wireless-controller-for-windows This video should also be helpful: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qY8PIGO_li8

context: Is the item durable?
response: The wheel is very solid.  When you feel it you know it will last for a really long time.  I use mine all the time and have had no issues at all with anything breaking or even showing signs of wear.  It is a well built piece.

context: Is there preset button mapping for Elite Dangerous available? Has anyone used this particular HOTAS in Elite Dangerous, and how well does it function?
response: Yes, Elite;Dangerous has a preset in its settings. It works well, but I use pedals for yaw.

context: If I'm an adult and I play this game, should I be publicly executed or just shunned from all society?
response: Hope not. I am 57 and having a blast playing it.

context: 26.5 pounds ? but other webside said it just 4kg,are you sure about this?
response: Lol, it's definitely not 26.5 pounds. Can't tell you the exact weight but it's not that.

context: Is it for Windows 7
response: Like everyone else said, it works fine on Win7, which is what I am using right now.

context: Will Rome Gold Edition work with Windows 8 ?
response: I don't know for sure, but I'll check. We gave the game to my mom since it was too hard and complicated for us, I'll find out from her. I would think that it should work with Windows 8 though.

context: Is the mic detachable?
response: Yes it is detachable

context: Does it have volume controls on it and a mute button? The picture does not zoom in so I can't see.
response: Yes, just above the gaming panel on the left there are a series of buttons, an up and down arrow, and a speaker with an x. These are your volume controls.

context: I'm currently stationed in Japan right now but I have an account registered in the NA region. Would I be able to use this to add days to my account?
response: You can only use a time card based on your account so if its an american account only american card will work and vice versa

context: Is there a warranty with this mouse?
response: page 14  of master guide  included with the box is information on the 2 year limited warrantyyou can view details here http://www.razerzone.com/warranty

context: is this compatible with xbox 360?
response: This was not complicated at all. The graphics are brilliant. . . my six year old loves it to pieces!!!

context: Do you need a 3d tv
response: No, it is not necessary. The game has a 3d perspective.

context: is the scroll wheel free-scrolling?
response: No, it is not. It is a very nice roll and not hard to move at all, though.

context: Is this headset wireless?
response: No, it plugs into an adapter that plugs into the Xbox controller

context: Does the PC version on disc also come with a steam code?  I'm guessing no because of UPlay but figured wouldn't hurt to ask.  Thx! :)
response: I have the retail version, and it is for Uplay only.

context: What is the difference between SH4 and SH4 gold edition?
response: I believe the gold edition contains the expansion pack it is on the box says: all new u-boat missions

context: Is this game compatible with an Xbox 360 controller? Many PC games are.
response: Yes it is, I used it many times with this game (I have a wired controller).

context: Are you able to save your games?
response: Yes, I have had no problem doing it so far.

context: does it work for the xbox 1
response: Yes they will work and they work very well

context: Rummikub Does anyone know if this includes Rummikub?
response: yes, but under the name "rummy squares."

context: Does it require my original tv remote or can I program it to my tv using codes?
response: Does not require your original TV remote unless you need to program specific buttons to your universal remote.
